name: headquarters
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 the main offices of an organization such as the army, the police, or a business company: The company's headquarters is/are in Amsterdam.
More examplesFewer examplesThe rebel headquarters took a direct hit from a bomb during the attack.The company's national headquarters is in Rome.A surgical strike was carried out on the enemy's military headquarters.The new company headquarters will be built on a 132-acre tract in Irving.The divisional managers have been called to a meeting at the company headquarters.

the main offices or center of operations of an organization, such as the army, police, or a company headquartered adjective us/ˈhedˌkwɔr·t̬ərd/
The 15-person company will be headquartered in San Francisco.
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] the main office or centre of control of a company or organization: The company has its European headquarters in Brussels.
[ U ] the management team who work at a headquarters: Regional managers are mostly free to operate without interference from headquarters.
